frameDefinitions: In this frame a Fluid moves from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.  '
An object (the Theme) moves away from a Source.
These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
In this frame an Emission emanates from a Source along a Path or to a Goal.
In this frame a Source_emitter discharges its Emission along a Path or to a Goal.  ' (1)
frameExamples: Robin <t>sold</t> a car to Abby for $5,000.
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
(1) The factory <t>exudes</t> toxic fumes from three large chimneys.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Area</fen> is the setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place on an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up.
The <fen>Path</fen> is the trajectory along which the <fen>Fluid</fen> moves.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> occupies initially.
The <fen>Fluid</fen> is the entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fluid</fen> flows.
The Place describes the location of the motion which has a specified Source, Path or Goal.
This is the object which moves. It may be an entity which moves under its own power, but it need not be.

All the verbs in this frame express some change of location, away from one place and to another. Any constituent that expresses the initial position of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before the change of location, is tagged with <fen>Source</fen>. Often the <fen>Source</fen> is understood from context.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the departure takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the departing takes place.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source</fen> .
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location from which the <fen>Emission</fen> emanates.
This role identifies the time when the emanation occurs.
The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item  from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>At Oregon Caves</fex>, a stream runs through the dining room.
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has sold more than three million copies.
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Board of the Reserve Bank of India

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Securities and Exchange Board of India
